main event: Two unidentified aerial objects were observed on 16 November 1952, in Imperial Beach, California.
interesting points: The first object observed was a large orange disk of light with a diameter of about 20-25 ft, The object traveled from south to north at a very high rate of speed, LCDR J.T. DUIS described observing a bright orange disk of light surrounded by a bluish-green halo, The sightings occurred under clear weather conditions with excellent visibility, Capt. C.J. Robold reported that the object exhibited rapid acceleration and deceleration with no trail or exhaust.
witness description: Capt. C.J. Robold, USMC; LCDR J.T. DUIS, JR., USN
